intro: Arctotis rosea, commonly known as the pink marguerite or the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features showy, daisy-like flowers with bright pink petals surrounding a central disc of yellow florets. Arctotis rosea typically grows as a perennial shrub with hairy, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sunlight, making it a popular choice for garden landscapes.
